home.welcome: Welcome to the LFIT's Humanitarian Club's Website !

about-us.title: About Us
about-us.text: Founded in 2014 by motivated students during a fundraising for Unicef, the Humanitarian Club of the LFIT is a non-profit organisation dedicated to fostering a spirit of compassion and community service among high school students. We engage in a variety of projects aimed at helping locals, children, animals, people outside Japan, and educating and protecting the environment. Members participate in volunteer efforts, educational initiatives, and awareness campaigns to make a positive impact.

join-us.title: How to join us
join-us.text:
Since we are primarily junior and senior year students, we greatly appreciate the help of younger students who have more free time. 
We welcome project suggestions from everyone, and volunteers of all ages are encouraged to join us !

help-us.title: How to help us
help-us.text: To support us, you can either volunteer or donate. You can choose a specific theme to donate to (education, helping locals, children, actions abroad, environment, animals).

education.title: Education
education.subtitle: Our Commitment
education.text: We focus on enhancing educational opportunities for underprivileged students through tutoring, school supply donations, and scholarships. Our efforts empower students by improving their access to quality education and fostering a love for learning.

children.title: Children
children.subtitle: Our Commitment
children.text:
We also aim to help children living in unstable environments who lack access to education, healthcare, and nutritious food. Providing support like educational programs, mentorship, and safe spaces can help them develop essential skills and confidence. Ensuring they receive proper healthcare and emotional support promotes their well-being. Our efforts can break the cycle of poverty and create a more equitable society where every child has the opportunity to thrive.

That is why, we have previously collaborated with UNICEF to raise funds. Through initiatives like selling handmade cakes, we've successfully raised 70,190 yen to support their mission. These funds enable UNICEF to provide crucial assistance to vulnerable children worldwide, aligning with our shared vision of creating a brighter future for all.

environment.title: Environment
environment.subtitle: Our Commitment
environment.text: Protecting the environment is vital for the well-being of our planet. We face challenges like pollution, habitat destruction, and climate change. To address these issues, we must reduce pollution, conserve natural habitats, and combat climate change. Simple actions like reducing energy consumption and supporting eco-friendly products can make a significant impact. Let's work together to create a healthier, more sustainable world for future generations.

outside-of-japan.title: Outside of Japan
outside-of-japan.subtitle: Our Commitment
outside-of-japan.text:
Recognizing that humanitarian efforts know no borders, we extend our outreach beyond Japan. We collaborate with international organisations to support global causes such as disaster relief, poverty alleviation, and educational support in developing countries. Our goal is to contribute to a more just and compassionate world.

This is why, this year, we have organised an operation to collect books and toys to donate to the association Shapla Neer. This association is dedicated to helping underprivileged communities in South Asia.

locals.title: Locals
locals.subtitle: Our Commitment
locals.text:
It is also important to us to help those who need it the most in our communities. Our efforts to help those in need are driven by a desire to make a positive impact and create a more equitable society. By giving our support, we can offer hope and assistance during difficult times.

For the past year, we have organised campaigns to collect first need items at school but also have also been involved in Tokyo Spring Homeless Patrol’s initiative. 
 Tokyo Springs Homeless Patrol is an organization dedicated to distributing meals and essential items to homeless individuals. Through our participation in their Wednesday patrols, we directly contribute to providing much-needed support to those experiencing homelessness, reinforcing our commitment to community welfare and compassionate action.

animals.title: Animals
animals.subtitle: Our Commitment
animals.text:
Protecting and helping animals is crucial for us. Indeed, they face threats like habitat destruction, pollution, and exploitation due to human activities.
Preserving habitats is key to animal protection. Conserving natural areas like forests and oceans ensures wildlife have places to thrive and maintains ecosystem balance and biodiversity.
Preventing cruelty and exploitation is another crucial aspect. This involves advocating for stronger animal welfare laws, supporting rescue organisations, and promoting cruelty-free practices.
Individual actions matter too. Adopting animals from shelters, supporting wildlife conservation projects, and choosing cruelty-free products can all make a difference.
Ultimately, protecting animals is vital for ecosystem health and our planet's well-being. By conserving habitats, preventing cruelty, and promoting ethical treatment, we can create a world where animals are valued members of our global community.
